Posts.Content: Sending prayers your way for a healthy and happy 2018! Im a 53 yr old lady on this site trying to learn for my father who was recently diagnosed and I must say you men are awesome!
Posts.Title: First holiday season with cancer.

Posts.Content: Hello and welcome, you will find many knowledgeable and friendly people on this board!
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer diagnosis

Posts.Content: Hello, I'm new here also and just wanted to say welcome. My father was diagnosed last week. He had the scans done yesterday and we are awaiting results. Stay strong, you are not alone and there is alot of great info on this board. I was in a fog the first few days after we found out, but a week in and am feeling somewhat better. It's a process...
Posts.Title: Question for my father pc, lost , confused

Posts.Content: Yes, I concur with the others, pretty standard. My father had these done when first diagnosed. Hes a big baby and made out fine! The worst part was waiting for the results after. Which we had to do the week of Christmas! If they dont call you in a reasonable amount of time call them.
Posts.Title: BONE and CAT Scan - what to except

Posts.Content: As I read thru all the posts I don't see much mentioned about chemo. Is this typically not an option for prostate cancer treatment? I mainly see surgery and radiation. Thanks, still learning.
Posts.Title: Question on treatment options

Posts.Content: Hi Kathy, I'm new here and can't offer much but wanted to let you know I'm thinking about you and sending prayers your way. Stay Strong. My Dad was just diagnosed a week ago and we are currently awaiting results of scans.
Posts.Title: Worried about my Dad

Posts.Content: Hello, I am new here and can't offer much at this point but wanted to send thoughts and prayers your way. Stay Strong.
Posts.Title: How concerned should I be?

Posts.Content: Wow, what a process. I didnt realize how long it took from diagnosis to actually starting treatment. We met with the RO this week and the best course of treatment for my Dad is external radiation and hormone injections. He will get his first injection in January, wait one month then have gold markers placed in the prostate, 2 weeks later get CT scan and the little tattoo markers, then 2 weeks later start radiation. Holy hell! So we are talking end of March before he starts radiation. Spring will be arriving! Has this been everyone elses experience? Just seems like such a long time since being diagnosed. And the fact that he hadnt been to the Urologist since 2014, I keep thinking this has been festering for some time already. We feel good about his treatment plan and are going to enjoy the holidays and hit this full steam ahead in the new year! Was just curious if it typically takes this long.
Posts.Title: EBRT and HT not for several months

Posts.Content: Hello, I am new here and can't offer much at this point but wanted to send thoughts and prayers your way. Stay Strong.
Posts.Title: How concerned should I be?

Posts.Content: I'm finally getting around to adding signature stats so hoping this works. Thanks for all the support. At this point just riding out the rest of the year and next steps will be to meet with the Urologist on Jan 3, 2018.
Posts.Signature: 53 Yr Old Female (here on behalf of my Father): 75 years old when diagnosed 2014-2017: PSA had been slightly rising over the years Jul 28 2017: PSA 6.2, had contrast MRI done, 2 suspicious areas at the Apex Nov 21, 2017: Had MRI Fusion Biopsy done. Dec 7, 2017: Received diagnosis 7 Cores: (1) 4+5 = 9 (3) 4+3 = 7 (2) 3+4 = 7 (1) 3+3 = 6 Stage: T2b Dec 15, 2017: Had CT Scan and Bone Scan done. Both clear. Dec 21, 2017: Met with Rad/Onc - course of treatment will be EBRT (9 wks) & HT Jan 22, 2018: First Hormone Shot Mar 19 - May 21, 2018: 9 weeks of EBRT
Posts.Title: EBRT and HT not for several months

Posts.Content: Hello All, I am so grateful to have found this board. My father was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer. I am trying to remain calm and worry free (hard to do) while we go thru this process and figure out the next steps, as well as learning all I can about the disease. He is 75 years old. We met with his Urologist last week after getting his biopsy results back. We were hoping for a better result but are dealing with this day by day. His Gleason score is 9, his PSA is 6.2 He is going tomorrow to have a CT scan and bone scan done. Once we get those results back that will determine the course of treatment. I know that the Gleason score is on the very high end which isn't good, but I'm confused by the PSA level. With the PSA being on the lower end is there some hope that this could still be localized? Or doesn't that matter with such a high Gleason score? As you know, the waiting is the worst part. I'll be anxious to get the results of the scans back sometime next week. Thank you for any info you can give me.
Posts.Title: New Here, seeking guidance, father recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for the warm welcome. He has been followed closely by his Urologist for about 10 years now. However, I recently found out he decided to skip his visit last year so it's been 2 years since he was checked. That was a blow to hear. What's the old saying - you can lead a horse to water but can't make it drink. I hope that decision doesn't come back to bite him. The PSA has gone up slightly over the years but nothing significant. When he went in August of this year it had gone up a little more and the Urologist recommended having an MRI done. The results of that showed 2 areas of concern. He had the biopsy done in mid-Nov. I was frustrated that it took 3 months to get in for the biopsy. Seemed like a long time to me but we were told they wanted to use the new MRI guided equipment and that's how long it took to get in. Here is some additional information on his biopsies: 7 cores taken - here is a breakout of the numbers which I'm still trying to understand. He didn't mention anything as far as what % of each was cancer. He just talked in terms of low, med, and high risk. With the one that is a 9 being high risk. There was one that was so insignificant he said it wasn't worth discussion so there are 6. 2 3+4 = 7 3 4+3 = 7 1 4+5 = 9
Posts.Title: New Here, seeking guidance, father recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Thanks for your insight. Im new to this (here on behalf of my father). I guess everyones situation is unique. Best thing we can do is get educated, consider all factors, and then make a good decision we are comfortable with.
Posts.Title: How to decide on treatment, facts, and prejudices.

Posts.Content: Thanks for your insight. Im new to this (here on behalf of my father). I guess everyones situation is unique. Best thing we can do is get educated, consider all factors, and then make a good decision we are comfortable with.

Posts.Title: New Here, seeking guidance, father recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hello All, I am so grateful to have found this board. My father was recently diagnosed with prostate cancer. I am trying to remain calm and worry free (hard to do) while we go thru this process and figure out the next steps, as well as learning all I can about the disease. He is 75 years old. We met with his Urologist last week after getting his biopsy results back. We were hoping for a better result but are dealing with this day by day. His Gleason score is 9, his PSA is 6.2 He is going tomorrow to have a CT scan and bone scan done. Once we get those results back that will determine the course of treatment. Posts.Title: New Here, seeking guidance, father recently diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hello ghost, and welcome! Your situation is very similar to my father's. I just found this board this week also and he was just diagnosed last week. He is a little older than your Dad, 75. His PSA is 6.2 and he is at a 9 Gleason. Try to remain calm, and positive, and learn as much as you can so you are well informed. I've had a week to absorb this and am starting to feel more like myself again and trying to accept this new normal. As others have said the scans are the next step. My Dad had his CT Scan and bone scan done yesterday. I was grateful he got there because it was snowing like Hell in Baltimore! Like you I find myself scared that it has spread. So now we wait.... I think I will feel better once I know one way or the other what we're dealing with and the treatment plan. Please keep us posted. Sorry you are here but glad that you found this support system. There is a wealth of knowledge here! Stay Strong.
Posts.Title: Dad just diagnosed with PC & trying to understand labs

Posts.Content: Hello All, I haven't been on the board in a while but always reading and learning. My father has finished up with his 9 weeks of EBRT. His last treatment was on May 21. He had a follow-up appointment today with his Urologist. I guess I was expecting them to do a PSA test, but he said no. His Urologist said "no use getting a PSA test because the hormones and the radiation will render that useless as it should read zero now". I get that, but how are you going to know if it is at Zero unless you do a PSA test??? I'm confused. At what point in time should he be getting a PSA test done now that his treatments are over? The Urologist said nothing to do at this point in time until the end of July when he will get his 2nd hormone shot. They may send him for a bone density scan down the road, the one he had in January was normal. From your experiences does this course of action sound right? Do they wait a little while after treatments before doing another PSA test?

Dec 7, 2017: Received diagnosis 7 Cores: (1) 4+5 = 9 (3) 4+3 = 7 (2) 3+4 = 7 (1) 3+3 = 6 Stage: T2b Dec 15, 2017: Had CT Scan and Bone Scan done. Both clear. Dec 21, 2017: Met with Rad/Onc - course of treatment will be EBRT (9 wks) & HT Jan 22, 2018: First Hormone Shot Mar 19 - May 21, 2018: 9 weeks of EBRT
Posts.Title: Father finished with treatments, question on follow-up moving forward

Posts.Content: Hello Dear Friends, we continue to play the waiting game in between appointments. My father had his first hormone injection a few weeks ago and on Thursday he goes to have the markers placed. Im wondering how involved this procedure is? He insists he doesnt need anyone to go with him. The Urologist confirmed that and said hed be in and out within an hour. They are not putting him to sleep just doing a local. I found that odd since he was put to sleep for the biopsy and this seems similar. Can anyone shed some light on this procedure and what to expect? His spirits have been good. Weve accepted this new normal and are pushing through. Im anxious to get the radiation started.

Posts.Content: Thanks so much all. We met with the RO this week. What a process... as you know. Will update in a new thread.
Posts.Title: Scans clear!

Posts.Content: Just received word that the CT scan and Bone scan for my Dad are all clear. Tomorrow we have an appt with the Radiologist/Oncologist to figure out best course for treatment. Im going to take this afternoon to breathe... thank you all for your support.
Posts.Title: Scans clear!
